list_definition.definition: a musical instrument similar to a guitar

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He played a tune on the mandolin.

list_ex_of_english: A power trio of keyboards, key bass, drums, fiddle mandolin, and vocals, the celebration is a surprisingly full sound for a party of three.
The strong pluckings and tremolos of the mandolin-banjos (when the accordions are not playing their solo parts, for example) give the piece a flavour of their own.
A very small run of lap steels, banjos and mandolins were also built but are rare to come across.
On the whole these are played competently, though not spectacularly; the decision to use a variety of solo instruments including mandolin is a welcome piece of imaginative freedom.
They use many different instruments such as the cello, violin, flute, didgeridoo, marimba, mandolin, sitar and vibraphone.
He plays a variety of instruments, such as piano/keyboard, bass, harp, and mandolin, with the guitar being his first love.
It adds pedal steel, dobro, fiddle and mandolin to the guitar and bass emphasis of rock and then throws in the blue-eyed soul of countrified gospel piano.
He commonly played instruments such as the washboard and the mandolin.
